psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 107,23]]Some went off to sea in ships, plied their trade on the deep waters.
[[Ps 107,24]]They saw the works of the LORD, the wonders of God in the deep.
[[Ps 107,25]]He spoke and roused a storm wind; it tossed the waves on high.
[[Ps 107,26]]They rose up to the heavens, sank to the depths; their hearts trembled at the danger.

[[Ps 107,28]]In their distress they cried to the LORD, who brought them out of their peril,
[[Ps 107,29]]Hushed the storm to a murmur; the waves of the sea were stilled.
[[Ps 107,30]]They rejoiced that the sea grew calm, that God brought them to the harbor they longed for.
[[Ps 107,31]]Let them thank the LORD for such kindness, such wondrous deeds for mere mortals.

second_reading.title: Second Letter to the Corinthians
second_reading.text:
[[2_Co 5,14]]Brothers and sisters: The love of Christ impels us, once we have come to the conviction that one died for all; therefore, all have died.
[[2_Co 5,15]]He indeed died for all, so that those who live might no longer live for themselves but for him who for their sake died and was raised.
[[2_Co 5,16]]Consequently, from now on we regard no one according to the flesh; even if we once knew Christ according to the flesh, yet now we know him so no longer.
[[2_Co 5,17]]So whoever is in Christ is a new creation: the old things have passed away; behold, new things have come.

first_reading.title: Book of Job
first_reading.text:
[[Jb 38,1]]The LORD addressed Job out of the storm and said :
[[Jb 38,8]]And who shut within doors the sea, when it burst forth from the womb;
[[Jb 38,9]]When I made the clouds its garment and thick darkness its swaddling bands?
[[Jb 38,10]]When I set limits for it and fastened the bar of its door,
[[Jb 38,11]]And said: Thus far shall you come but no farther, and here shall your proud waves be stilled!

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 4,35]]On that day, as evening drew on, Jesus said to his disciples: "Let us cross to the other side."
[[Mc 4,36]]Leaving the crowd, they took him with them in the boat just as he was. And other boats were with him.
[[Mc 4,37]]A violent squall came up and waves were breaking over the boat, so that it was already filling up.
[[Mc 4,38]]Jesus was in the stern, asleep on a cushion. They woke him and said to him, "Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing?"
[[Mc 4,39]]He woke up, rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, "Quiet! Be still!" The wind ceased and there was great calm.
[[Mc 4,40]]Then he asked them, "Why are you terrified? Do you not yet have faith?"
[[Mc 4,41]]They were filled with great awe and said to one another, "Who then is this whom even wind and sea obey?"
